meanings.definition: To make a fool of oneself.
meanings.sent1: He beclowned himself by tripping over his own feet in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: She tends to beclown herself when she tries to tell jokes that fall flat.
meanings.sent3: The comedian beclowned himself by attempting a magic trick that went terribly wrong.
meanings.sent4: His failed attempt at singing beclowned him in front of the entire audience.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter managed to beclown himself by spilling drinks on the guests.

meanings.definition: To act in a ridiculous or absurd manner.
meanings.sent1: The clown beclowned around the circus tent, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: During the play, the actor beclowned on stage, causing the audience to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent3: The politician beclowned during the debate by making silly faces at the opponent.
meanings.sent4: The toddler beclowned in the sandbox, pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent5: The students beclowned in the school play, wearing outrageous costumes and dancing wildly.
